definition: devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
obstructed/to fail/to oppress/to repress/to lower the tone/to bend back/to dampen

sentences.english: Tumbling this price positions significantly increase potential null layout has been positive.
sentences.chinese: 今價重挫持倉量大幅遞增，追勢空單佈局甚爲積極。

sentences.english: Our team got creamed in the semi-finals so we din’t win a trophy.
sentences.chinese: 我們隊在幾個半決賽中遭受重挫，沒有贏到獎牌。

sentences.english: She traveled throughout Africa and to Haiti afterthe catastrophic earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 她走遍了非洲，以及遭地震重挫的海地。

sentences.english: The economy got absolutely creamed after the financial crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在金融危機過後，國家的經濟遭受重挫。

sentences.english: Tumbling yesterday price increments until positions, potential null layout actions.
sentences.chinese: 昨價重挫持倉量續遞增，追勢空單佈局動作大。

sentences.english: High-tech stocks plummeted across the board today.
sentences.chinese: 高科技股今天全面重挫。

sentences.english: Investors seemed equally underwhelmed, as VanceInfo's shares dropped 10 percent in NYSE trading.
sentences.chinese: 投資者看來也不太買賬，其股價週一重挫10%。

sentences.english: Tumbled harness leather trim with matching single keeper.
sentences.chinese: 利用皮革裝飾相匹配的單門將重挫。

definition: (of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
(military) (of a city etc) to fall into enemy hands/(fig.) to take a turn for the worse
(of a stock on the stock market) to close at (a certain price)
NASDAQ/National Association of Securities Dealers Automated Quotations, a computerized data system to provide brokers with price quotations for securities traded over the counter
to lose what one has just obtained (idiom)
